title: D-Day Invasion Overview Map
description: Overview map showing the five invasion beaches and the routes taken by Allied forces on June 6, 1944. This map shows the assault areas, airborne drop zones, and naval approach routes.
credit: U.S. Military, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

title: Beach Sectors and Landing Zones
description: Detailed map of the five landing beaches showing individual sectors (Easy Red, Dog Green, etc.) and assigned units. Understanding the beach sectors helps explain the varied experiences of different units.
credit: U.S. Army Center of Military History, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

title: Airborne Drop Zones
description: Map showing the planned and actual drop zones for American 82nd and 101st Airborne Divisions on the Cotentin Peninsula, and British 6th Airborne Division east of the Orne River.
credit: U.S. Army, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

title: Omaha Beach Assault Map
description: Detailed map of Omaha Beach showing the German defensive positions, beach obstacles, and American assault routes. This map helps explain why Omaha was the bloodiest beach.
credit: U.S. Army, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

title: Utah Beach Landing Map
description: Map of the Utah Beach sector showing the actual landing site (displaced by currents) and the planned objectives including Sainte-Mère-Église and the causeway exits.
credit: U.S. Army, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

title: Atlantic Wall Fortifications
description: Map showing the extent of German Atlantic Wall defenses along the French coast. The map illustrates why the Pas-de-Calais was more heavily defended than Normandy.
credit: Goran tek-en, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons

title: Gold, Juno, and Sword Beaches
description: Map of the British and Canadian landing sectors showing Gold, Juno, and Sword beaches, with planned objectives including the capture of Caen.
credit: U.S. Army, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

title: Normandy Campaign Overview
description: Map showing the progression of the Normandy campaign from D-Day through Operation Cobra and the breakout. Includes major battle locations and the eventual encirclement at Falaise.
credit: U.S. Army Center of Military History, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

title: Pegasus Bridge Operation
description: Detailed map of the British glider assault on Pegasus Bridge (Bénouville Bridge) and the Orne River Bridge, showing glider landing positions and the assault routes.
credit: Noclador, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons

title: Mulberry Harbor Locations
description: Map showing the locations of the two Mulberry artificial harbors: Mulberry A at Omaha Beach (destroyed by storm) and Mulberry B at Arromanches (Gold Beach).
